My most played game on Steam. 

An incredibly addicting game, if not a simple one. 

The good: Mechanics are solid and easy to grasp, low skill floor, high skill ceiling. Genuinely scary starting off, but with a minimal amount of playtime it becomes less so, transitioning to a puzzle game rather than a horror one. Can still catch you unawares, though, which is nice. Play it alone and it can be terrifying. Absolutely a riot with friends, as you can both get things done, or mess with them and laugh at their untimely paranormal deaths. 

The bad: Gameplay loop can be repetitive, even monotonous at times. Scares can get stale, and eventually the game seems to lose its luster and challenge. Lacking in some diversity of maps, lower tier equipment can be frustrating and not as intuitive to use. Updates are infrequent.

The ugly: Mostly bugs. Not many gamebreaking ones, but some allow you to noclip into certain spots. Sometimes ghosts will behave incorrectly, or not show evidences they're supposed to. Hackers exist, though are incredibly rare to see. Most will be annoying at most. 

Overall, I think Phasmophobia is an excellent game that is well worth its value. It can still provide some scares and can be incredibly mentally engaging, though these effects can wane with time. Up to you to keep your experience fresh. I recommend it played with friends, and that you challenge yourself to do risky things and have fun with it rather than take it completely serious if you want the best experience.

I will say it is more enjoyable with friends, but can be contently played solo as well. VR makes it even more incredible. I already almost have 100 hours in this game and have barely owned it a month. My friends are the same way, and we play it almost every night before we hop off, sometimes all night. 

My second biggest praise in regards to this game are how active the devs are in listening to the community they have developed. They are active on all socials and constantly evolving the game with fun and interactive challenges, new updates, and more. 

I will say the game can become a bit mundane after like level 60 or so, simply because you start to learn ghost behaviors and signs. Good news is there is a simple fix, do custom mode and make it harder, prestige and reset all equipment, set personal goals, the game truly never gets "old". We just get more experienced. 

Overall I would absolutely recommend this game to one and all, Happy hunting!

I have played both the early and current versions of Phasmophobia, and can definitely say that the developers have given a lot of love and care to this game over the years. The difficulty, progression, learning curve, and captivation have all been vastly improved while maintaining the staple 'rawness' of the game. The current state of the game is the best it has ever been.
There are plenty of features to keep you excited about the game: multiple unlocked tiers for each item, custom difficulties and challenges such as apocalypse, in-game events, many different ghosts with vastly different behaviors, and plenty of locations to choose from. Each game is a different experience, and I really appreciate the variety that has been added to the game.
Where the game really shines is in multiplayer. Working together as a semi-functional team facing your fears together in a world with an interesting physics system couldn't be more fun. The ability to interact with your dead friends adds a lot of hilarious depth to the game if used correctly, and the ability to get them killed is even funnier. This game is meant to be played in a team environment, especially if you don't take it too seriously.  
My only major gripe with the game is the grindiness to upgrade the items and to unlock each achievement. For reference, I have nearly 40ish hours of meaningful gameplay in the new update, where I started at level 1. I am only level 80 and need to get to level 100 for just one of the two prestiges I need to 100% the game. Specifically those achievements add no real substance to the game, just a grind. Granted, I wasn't all the way efficient in my gameplay when it comes to leveling up and actually living, but needing 40+ hours as an inexperienced player to have not even unlocked the full loadout is insane. 
I love this game and have done every achievement thus far besides the grindy ones. I would definitely recommend this game, but I don't fully recommend trying to unlock every achievement or even trying to unlock the full loadout unless you really love Phasmophobia.
